name: Airbus A319
description: ICAO RFF Req: Min 7,900L water. Discharge: 3,000 L/min. Overwing exits are plug-type; ensure slides are disarmed before exterior handle pull.

name: Airbus A320
description: ICAO RFF Req: Min 7,900L water. Discharge: 3,000 L/min. High-pressure oxygen bottles located in forward cargo hold.

name: Airbus A321
description: ICAO RFF Req: Min 12,100L water. Discharge: 5,300 L/min. Stretched fuselage hazard for center-tank fires. Main gear is dual-tandem.

name: Airbus A380
batteries: Multiple Li-ion locations in E/E Bays
description: ICAO RFF Req: Min 32,300L water. Discharge: 11,200 L/min. Double-deck evacuation hazard. GLARE skin is highly fire-resistant.

name: Airseeker R.1 (RC-135W)
description: Tactical Intelligence. Significant cooling requirements for electronics. Avoid boarding while mission systems are active due to RF hazard.

name: BAe Hawk
description: Jet Trainer. HAZARD: Ejector seats (Martin-Baker Mk.10) must be pinned before ground rescue attempts. High-pressure hydraulics.

name: Beechcraft Super King Air
description: ICAO RFF Req: Min 1,200L water. Discharge: 820 L/min. Beware of spinning propellers. Battery master located in cockpit overhead.

name: V-22 Osprey
description: Tiltrotor. High downwash during VTOL. Engine nacelles contain high-temperature components. Prop-rotors present severe approach hazard.

name: Boeing 747-8F
description: ICAO RFF Req: Min 32,300L water. Dedicated freighter. Primary rescue entry is via the upper deck. No windows on main deck.

name: Boeing 767-300
description: ICAO RFF Req: Min 18,200L water. Discharge: 7,200 L/min. Twin-aisle widebody. Evacuation slides are dual-lane.

name: AH-64D Apache
description: Attack Helicopter. HAZARD: Live ordnance/rockets. Canopy jettison uses explosive charges. High-intensity Longbow radar.

name: Boeing E-7 Wedgetail
description: Tactical AEW&C. MESA radar structure on top affects fuselage integrity and rescue entry. High RF radiation hazard.

name: C-130k Hercules
description: Tactical Airlift. High-wing allows low cargo ramp access. Defensive flare dispensers are a pyrotechnic hazard.

name: C-17 Globemaster III
description: Strategic Transport. APU in right wheel well sponson. High-pressure oxygen bottles in forward left fuselage. Rear ramp is primary egress.

name: CH-47 Chinook
description: Tandem Rotor. Fuel in side sponsons. Beware of low-swinging blades during shutdown. Engine fire-suppression access on top deck.

name: Airbus H135 (EC135)
description: ICAO Heliport Cat H2. Min 1,000L water req. Rear clamshell doors allow stretcher access. Fenestron tail is shrouded.

name: F-15 Eagle
description: Air Superiority. Hazards: Hydrazine (toxic), live missiles, and high-pressure hydraulics. Cockpit jettison is armed.

name: F-16 Fighting Falcon
description: Multi-role. DANGER: EPU uses Hydrazine (highly toxic). Do not approach if 'H' light is visible. Canopy release on port side.

name: F-22 Raptor
description: Stealth Fighter. Hazards: RAM (Radar Absorbent Material) coating is toxic when burning. SCBA/Full PPE required for response.

name: F-35 Lightning II
description: 5th Gen Stealth. Composite material risk (CFRP). Canopy release located on left-hand side under panel. Internal ordnance hazard.

name: Grob G 115 Tutor
description: Elementary trainer. Fully composite construction (GFRP). Fire causes rapid structural collapse. No ejector seats.

name: F/A-18 Hornet
description: Carrier Fighter. Hazard: Arresting hook hardware, live wing-tip ordnance. Magnesium landing gear components (flammable).

name: McDonnell Douglas DC-3
description: ICAO RFF Req: Min 2,400L water. Vintage airframe. Fuel leak risk from carburetors on impact. Propeller hazard.

name: Protector RG1
description: MALE RPAS. Hazards: High-intensity RF satellite dish. Precision ordnance. Sever engine links if responding while engine runs.

name: Saab JAS 39 Gripen
description: Delta-canard Fighter. Large percentage of composite skin. Hazards include cockpit ejection and high-speed turbine components.

name: Sikorsky UH-60 Black Hawk
description: Utility Helicopter. Sliding cabin doors. Tail boom contains drive shaft. Hazards: External fuel tanks (ESSS) and armor plates.

name: Eurofighter Typhoon
description: Swing-role. Hazards: Carbon fiber dust, high-pressure LOX, and ordnance. Cockpit canopy release is accessible from port side.

name: Voyager (A330 MRTT)
description: Strategic Tanker. Tactical: Massive center/wing fuel load. Mission consoles on flight deck. Refueling pods on wings.

name: A400M Atlas
description: Tactical Airlifter. Counter-rotating composite propellers. Fly-by-wire controls. High-capacity cargo ramp.
